result.name: fire_and_rescue_service_-_all_incidents_attended
result.notes:
This dataset covers incidents attended by fire and rescue services (FRS) in England and Wales, excluding the Isles of Scilly, covering a total of 49 FRS. The data include incidents that not only relate to fires, but also responses to special services, false alarms, and the casualties, rescues and fatalities that relate to those incidents.
Source: Communities and Local Government (CLG), Fire and Resilience Directorate (FRD)
Publisher: Neighbourhood Statistics
Geographies: Middle Layer Super Output Area (MSOA), Local Authority District (LAD), Government Office Region (GOR), National
Geographic coverage: England and Wales
Time coverage: 2001 to 2006
Type of data: Administrative data
Notes: These figures will help users to identify areas most at risk from having a fire, being involved in a special service incident or being subject to some types of anti-social behaviour (e.g. malicious false alarms). Figures will also assist the targeting of urban renewal programmes and community safety initiatives.

odi-certificate.title: Fire and rescue service: All incidents attended

organization.name: office-for-national-statistics
organization.title: Office for National Statistics
organization.description:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics and is the recognised national statistical institute for the UK. It is responsible for collecting and publishing statistics related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. It also conducts the census in England and Wales every ten years. 

The ONS plays a leading role in national and international good practice in the production of official statistics. It is the executive office of the UK Statistics Authority and although they are separate, they are still closely related.

result.precision: #The level of completeness vary between Fire and Rescue Services (FRS) and stands at 84% for England and Wales.#In order to protect confidentiality, the fatalities category has been excluded at Middle Super Output Area Level.
result.title: Fire and rescue service: All incidents attended
